description: Change of use from Serviced Hostel (50 rooms) (Use Class Sui Generis) to hotel (Use Class C1) with 59 rooms; conversion of third floor caf√© to 9 new rooms; construction of a single storey rear extension to provide guest lounge and cafe; associated external alterations; cycle parking and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be in accordance with drawing title numbers and approved documents: 1469_300 Location Plan, 1469_301 Site Plans Existing and Proposed, 1469_320_A_a Existing Lower Ground Floor Plan, 1469_321_B_a Existing Ground Floor Plan, 1469_322_B_a Existing First Floor Plan, 1469_323_B_a Existing Second Floor Plan, 1469_324_A_a Existing Third Floor Plan, 1469_325_A_a Existing Front Elevation, 1469_326_B_2_a Existing Side Elevation, 1469_327_C_a Existing Rear Elevation, 1469_340_B Proposed Elevations (received on 10/11/2022), 1469_341_A Proposed Lower Ground & Ground Floor Plans (received on 14/11/2022), 1469_342_A Proposed 1st/ 2nd & 3rd Floor Plans (received on 14/11/2022), 1469_407 Roof Plan, Heritage Statement, Transport Statement, Design and Access Statement (received on 12/07/2022), Schedule of Accommodation (received on 14/11/2022)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Reason: To safeguard the privacy and amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and London Plan (2021) policy D3.

| The sound insulation for hotel rooms shall comply with the requirements in BS8233:2014. Enhanced sound insulation of at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value is recommended for separations between bedrooms and adjoining bathrooms in separate units. These details shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policy D14;  Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating communal and non-residential uses from bedrooms, such as the cafe, lift, communal staircase, plant, utility and service rooms etc. shall be enhanced by at least 10dB above the recommended Building Regulations value for residential use. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS 8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013); standard 30 of the Housing SPG and London Plan (2021) policy D14.

| Within three months after the date of this planning permission, an overall Management Strategy for the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The strategy shall include:
o	Contact details of relevant personnel or the management company, who would be responsible for the management of the hotel;
o	Details of security measures including location of CCTV and associated equipment;
o	An Access Strategy including details of:
-    Points of access and how access these will be controlled,
-    Confirmation of disabled access arrangements;
o	The use of the lower ground floor restaurant, in relation to opening hours, food and alcohol;
o	Measures and procedures to prevent and deal with antisocial behaviour;
o       Use of the rear staircase;
o       Verification of Secured by Design accreditation;
The site shall be managed in accordance with the approved strategy for the life of the development or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of the proper maintenance, safety and security of the site and to ensure that the quality of the public realm is appropriately safeguarded in accordance with policies D3 and D11 of the London Plan(2021); policies 1.1(e), (g) and (h),1.2 (d) and (f), and 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Development (and Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.3 of the adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Within three after the date of this planning permission, a Fire Statement shall be submitted for approval, which shall include details of:
i.	appropriate features which reduce the risk to life in the event of a fire;
ii.	appropriate way to minimise the risk of fire spread;
iii.	provide suitable and convenient means of escape for all building users;
iv.	a robust strategy for evacuation;
v.	suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size; and use of the development.
In addition, the statement shall provide details of how the development proposal will function in terms of:

i.	the building's construction: methods, products and materials used, the means of escape for all building users: stair cores, escape for building users who are disabled or require level access, and the associated management plan approach

ii.	access for fire service personnel and equipment: how this will be achieved in an evacuation  situation, water supplies, provision and positioning of equipment, firefighting lifts, stairs and lobbies, any fire suppression and smoke ventilation systems proposed, and the ongoing maintenance and monitoring of these
iii.	how provision will be made within the site to enable fire appliances to gain access to the building.
The development shall be carried out in accordance with the fire statement.

Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users, development proposals must achieve the highest standards of fire safety, in accordance with policy D11 and D12 of the London Plan (2021).

| Notwithstanding the submitted details, a minimum of 10% of the hotel rooms shall be wheelchair accessible in line with policy E10 of the London Plan (2021) and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To ensure that the development is adaptable, flexible, convenient and appropriate for wheelchair users and the changing needs of the future occupiers, in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 DPD (2012) and policy D7 and E10 of the London Plan (2021).

| External artificial lighting at the development shall not exceed lux levels of vertical illumination at neighbouring premises that are recommended by the Institution of Lighting Professionals in the 'Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution 2011'. Lighting should be minimised and glare and sky glow should be prevented by correctly using, locating, aiming and shielding luminaires, in accordance with the Guidance Notes.

Reason: In the interests of the safety of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 7A and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013);  policies D4 and D11 of the London Plan(2021); and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The passenger lift of the approved scheme shall remain available for use thereafter	.

Reason: To ensure that adequate access is provided to all floors of the development for all occupiers and visitors including those with disabilities, in accordance with policy 1.1(h) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013); and policies D5 and D7 of the London Plan(2021).
| The three disabled parking spaces as shown on plan shall be retained for the lifetime of the development hereby approved
Reason: To ensure that adequate provision of access for occupants and visitors with disabilities, in accordance with policy T6.4 of the  London Plan(2021).
| At least 3 secure long-stay cycle parking spaces and 2 secure short-stay cycle parking space shall be provided on site and retained thereafter.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan(2021) policy T5 and table 10.2.
| Refuse and recycling storage shall be implemented in accordance with the Local Planning Authority policies and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development would not be harmful to the visual amenity of the locality, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) and policies D3 and T7 of the London Plan (2021).
| Use Class and Subdivision Restriction

The hotel hereby approved shall not be amalgamated or subdivided in any way which deviates from the approved size and layout which shall be retained unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. It shall also only be used as a hotel and for no other purposes within the schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended), without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use in order to restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 4.5 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy E10 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| Masts/Satellite Dishes or External Equipment

No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any elevation of the building hereby permitted without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason:  To safeguard the appearance of the buildings and the locality in the interests of visual amenity policies 1.1 (h), 1.1 (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
